section.name: What is JGGApi?
section.p: The jggapi is a Java Gadu-Gadu protocol implementation. jggapi uses that well-known design patterns that minimize learning curve. As a result developers can write Gadu-Gadu clients very fast.

section.name: What is the JGGApi license?
section.p: We use GPL open source license, therefore if you want to write the Gadu-Gadu client it must have GPL license as well. To find more about open-source licenses go to: www.opensource.org/licenses/

section.name: Who develops jggapi?
section.p: The project was founded by Marcin Naglik (mnaglik@gazeta.pl) in 2003. After couple of months Mateusz Szczap (mati@sz.home.pl) joined it and helped with the development process.
